item.title: Contributing
item.description: Thank you for your interest in RP9.This repository is not a conventional open-source project. It is a causally structured reference framework with a locked relational core.As such, contribution is intentionally restricted. Casual pull requests Feature additions Refactoring or stylistic changes Alternative axioms or foundational modifications ‚ÄúClarifications‚Äù that alter meaning or scope The core framework (Axiom 0, Definitions, Theorems, Relational Sheets A‚ÄìC) is not open to modification. Precise objections to internal coherence Identification of hidden assumptions Structural or categorical errors Formal critiques of derivations A single decisive objection is more valuable than extensive commentary.If you believe you have identified a structural flaw or inconsistency: Do not submit a pull request. Open an issue, or contact the author directly. State the objection clearly and minimally. Reference the exact document and section. No defense, debate, or iteration is expected unless explicitly requested.RP9 defines a closed relational circuit as cause. All further systems, interpretations, and applications are open consequences.This repository preserves the cause. Contributions are evaluated solely on whether they identify errors in that cause.If you build upon RP9 externally, attribution is required under the project license.Author: Anton Wallin Framework: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework Question This work is free to share, remix, and build upon, as long as proper attribution is given and the same license is maintained. item.title: README ‚Äî Overview
item.description: This document provides a formal, binary review of the RP9 submission package.The review checks three criteria only: All parts are in the correct place All parts are necessary (nothing missing, nothing superfluous) The structure is maximally clear and review-safe This is a pass / fail overview, not an interpretation. Part 1 ‚Äî Axiom R0 (Basic) Part 2 ‚Äî Formal Delimitation (Non-basic) Part 3 ‚Äî Category Definition and Status Levels (Non-basic) Part 4 ‚Äî Reviewer Notes / Instructions and Scope Lock (Non-basic) Appendix A ‚Äî Relational Potential (Interpretative support) This order is logically minimal, causally correct, and review-safe.Status: Ground Content: Three lines. One axiom. introduces no objects introduces no functions introduces no operations contains no meta-commentary Necessity: Absolute Redundancy: None Missing elements: None ‚úÖ Approved. Locked.Status: Non-ground, protectiveThis document: establishes that Axiom R0 is the only non-derivative statement prevents accidental introduction of structure defines explicit collapse conditions Without this document, the axiom would be vulnerable to misinterpretation.Necessity: Yes Redundancy: No ‚úÖ Approved. Required.Status: Non-ground, classificatoryThis document: defines LEVEL 0, LEVEL 1, LEVEL 2 locks the term axiom to Axiom R0 correctly places relational potential at LEVEL 1 places all function and combination at LEVEL 2 It adds no causality, only classification.Necessity: Yes, for correct review and interpretation Redundancy: No ‚úÖ Approved. Stable.Status: Non-ground, methodological contractThis document: limits the reviewer‚Äôs mandate specifies what must not be evaluated locks terminology and text type defines the only valid form of review conclusion This document is critical for external review.Necessity: Yes (externally) Redundancy: No ‚úÖ Approved. Critical component.Status: Appendix (non-ground)The appendix: adds no axioms adds no causal structure is fully dependent on Axiom R0 supports correct interpretation only It contains definitions, a corollary, and one illustrative diagram.Necessity: For the axiom: No For understanding and correct use: Yes This is exactly the role an appendix should have.‚úÖ Approved. Final.RP9 ‚Äî Submission Package (five documents) is: formally correct axiomatically minimal causally closed at the foundation methodologically locked It may be labeled: RP9 ‚Äî Submission Package v1.0 (Peer-Review Ready) Author: Anton Wallin Framework: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy FrameworkQuestion This work is free to share, remix, and build upon, as long as proper attribution is given and the same license is maintained. item.title: Top-level README
item.description:
This repository contains the complete, final public release of RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework (v1.0).RP9 is a single-axiom relational framework that specifies a closed causal origin while allowing open systemic consequences.No objects, forces, dimensions, measures, or empirical assumptions are postulated. Axiom count: exactly one (Axiom R0) Causal status: closed at the foundation Systemic consequences: open and non-restrictive Derivations: none at ground level Review status: methodologically locked RP9 does not compete with existing theories or frameworks. It specifies the condition under which any framework can function at all.This repository constitutes the frozen reference archive of RP9.It contains: the single axiom (LEVEL 0) formal boundary and classification documents (non-ground) reviewer instructions and scope lock appendices (interpretative, non-causal) a complete AI-based axiomatic stress test license and contribution policy Nothing outside this repository is required to review RP9 formally.An interactive inspection view of the material and the stress test is provided via Google NotebookLM.NotebookLM is provided as a read-only inspection view. This GitHub repository constitutes the authoritative record. üîó NotebookLM (read-only): https://notebooklm.google.com/notebook/e236eef3-cb07-4e55-8057-6cba4588ab16 Reviewers may recreate the stress test independently by using the archived material and running their own NotebookLM session: üîó New blank notebook:
https://notebooklm.google.com/ Start with Axiom R0 (LEVEL 0) Read Document I ‚Äî Formal Delimitation Read Document II ‚Äî Category Definition and Status Levels Read Document III ‚Äî Reviewer Notes / Scope Lock Consult appendices only after the above Appendices add no ground and no causal force. Framework version: v1.0 Relational circuit: closed System: open Review status: peer-review ready Change policy: locked at foundation This work is released under Creative Commons Attribution‚ÄìNonCommercial‚ÄìShareAlike 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-SA 4.0).You are free to: read share reference build upon the material externally under attribution and identical licensing for derivatives.Author: Anton Wallin Framework: RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy FrameworkQuestion This work is free to share, remix, and build upon, as long as proper attribution is given and the same license is maintained.
